data.title: James Tyrer Caldwell (1866-1934)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for James Caldwell born 1866 Liverpool, Lancashire, England died 1934 Bootle, West Derby, Lancashire, England including ancestors + descendants + 5 photos + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 10 Apr 2024 | Created 25 Dec 2017

This page has been accessed 637 times.

Do not confuse with James Tyrer Caldwell; James Tyrer Caldwell; James Tyrer Caldwell and DO NOT MERGE - they are different people.

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Birth and Baptism

1.2 Occupation

1.3 Marriage

1.4 Residence

1.5 First World War

1.6 Children

1.7 Death

1.8 Transcripts

2 Sources

3 Acknowledgements

Biography

Birth and Baptism

James was born at 74 Holden Street Liverpool on 16 March 1866 to James Tyrer Caldwell and Alice Scott.[1] He was baptized at St. Saviour's Church, Liverpool, on 22 April 1866.[2] [3]

Occupation

At age 15 he was working as an "office boy". [4] For most of his adult working life, James Tyrer was a mariner in the merchant service[5] [1]

Marriage

James Tyrer Caldwell Married Alice Farrell at Christ Church Waterloo on 29 March 1891. <[6]

Residence

1866. 74 Holden Street.[2]

1871. No 70 E Block. Civil Parish, Liverpool. [3]

1881.73 Chambers Street, Everton Liverpool. [4]

1891. James and his wife Alice (born Scott) lived at the home of her stepmother, Myra Pearson.[5]

1893. Time of birth of son, James Tyler Caldwell, the family lived at 5 Wordsworth St. Bootle.[7]

1897. At the time of the birth of daughter Alice, they resided at 38 Woodruff Street, Toxteth Park, Liverpool.

1901. James and Alice with three children lived at 1 St. John's Road Waterloo. [8]

1911. James and Alice with six children lived in a five room house at 56 Boswell Street, Bootle, Liverpool.[9]

First World War

James Caldwell served in the First World War. One document in his service record states that he was in the 63rd R.N. Division from 29 September 1914 until demobilization in 1919. All others documents in the same folder states that he served in the Royal Engineers from 23 August 1917 to 28 February 1919.

When James Caldwell enlisted in 1917, he was 51 years and 5 months old. He was 62 inches tall with a firth of 38 and a half inches when expanded. He had a ship tattoos on his forearm.[10] He signed up with he Royal Engineers Inland Waterway Transport Division.[11]

Children

James Tyrer Caldwell (1893 - 1948)

Walter Scott Caldwell(1895 - 1918) (Was not on 1911 Census). Do not confuse with Walter Scott Caldwell

Alice Caldwell (1897 - 1965)

Lillian Caldwell (1899 - 1899)[12]

George Hill Caldwell (1901 - 1963)

Joseph Mallison Caldwell (1903 - 1981)

Arthur Farrell Caldwell (1906 - 1908)

Arthur Leslie Caldwell (1908-1968)

Robert Henry Caldwell (1910 - 1981)

Albert Samuel Caldwell (1913 - 1961)

(NOTE: The above list has two children dead by 1911 which does not match what Alice Caldwell put on the 1911 Census return Sharon Caldwell).

Death

James Tyrer Caldwell passed away on 16 August 1934, age 68, at 152 Irlan (??) Road, Bootle.<[13] He is buried in Anfield Cemetery.[14]

Transcripts

Certified Copy of an Entry of Birth.[1]

Registration District: West Derby - Toxteth park 1866 Birth in the Sub-District of West Derby in the County of Lancaster: No. 237. When and where born. Sixteenth March 1866 74 Holden Street. Name: James Tyler. Sex: Boys. Name of father: James Tyler Caldwell. Name of mother: Alice Caldwell formerly Scott. Occupation of father: Seaman merchant service. Signature, description and residence of informant. Alice Caldwell, mother, 74 Holden Street, West Derby. Registered Eighteenth April 1866. Signature of Registrar. Richard Bradshaw Registrar.

Transcript of Baptism:[2]

Baptisms solemnized in the Parish of Liverpool, at St. Savior's Church in the County of Lancaster in the year 1866. ::(In margin- assumed d.o.b.) Mar 16, 1866. When baptized: April 22, 1866. No. 806. Child's Christian Name: James Tyra. [This is clearly a mistake when written by minister as the name is Tyrer on all other documents]. Parent's names: James Tyra and Alice Caldwell. Abode 74 Holden Street. Trade mariner. By whom ceremony performed Robert Irving.

Transcript of Entry of Marriage.[6]

1891 Marriage solemnized at Christ Church, Waterloo int h eParis of Sephton in the County of Lancaster.

No. 207. When married: March 29th 189.

(Groom) James Tyler Caldwell, 25 , Bachelor, Mariner. Father: James Tyrer Caldwell (dec.) Mariner.

(Bride) Alice Farrell, 20, Spinster, Father: William Farrell (dec) Carter.

Residence at time of Marriage (Both) Waterloo.

Married in Christ Church Waterloo according to the Rites and Ceremonies of the Established Church by ... or after Bans by me, J. K. Dickson (Incumbent)

This Marriage was solemnized between us James Tyler Caldwell and Alice Farrell in the presence of us David M. Parker and Mary Smith.

Transcript 1871 Census:[3]

Address: No 70 E Block. Civil Parish/ City of Liverpool. Municipal Ward of Scotland.Ecclesiastical District of St. Martin. Entry No. 404.

James Caldwell, Head, Mar., 38, Occupation rigger,

Alice Caldwell, Wife, Mar., 32,

Mary Caldwell, Daur, 9, Scholar

Agnes Caldwell, Daur, 6, Scholar

James Caldwell, Son, 5, Scholar

William Caldwell, Son, 1

All Born Lancashire, Liverpool.

Transcript 1881 Census:[4]

Address: Civil parish/municipal ward Everton, City of Liverpool. Ecclesiastical District of St. Georges. Schedule No. 252. 73 Chambers Street,

James Caldwell, Head, Mar., 48, Occupation rigger,

Alice Caldwell, Wife, Mar., 45,

Agnes Caldwell, Daur,unmarried, 16,

James T. Caldwell, Son, 15, Office Boy

WilliamA. Caldwell, Son, 11, Scholar

Margaret Caldwell, Daughter 8, Scholar

Adaml, Son, 6, Scholar

All Born Lancashire, Liverpool.

Transcript 1891 Census:[5]

Address: Civil Parish Great Crosby, Village Waterloo, Division Sothport, Paris of St. John's. 15 Sweden Street.

Myra A. Pearson. Head. Wid. 46. Station cleaner (illegible) Born Lancashire Liverpool

George Pearson. Son 11 scholar. Born Salford, Manchester

Martha Pearson. Dau. 7 scholar. Born Lacashire, Waterloo

Myra M. Pearson Dau. 6 scholar Born Lacashire, Waterloo

:James T. Caldwell (son-in-law) M. 25 mariner Born Lancashire Edgehill

Alice Caldwell dau. M. 24 Born Hulme Manchester.

Transcript 1901 Census:[8]

Address: Civil parish Waterloo, Eccl. Parish of St. John. 1 St. John's Road.

Schedule No 70.

James T. Caldwell, Head, M. 35. Occup. Seaman in dock board dredger(??), Worker, born Lancs. Liverpool

Alice Caldwell, wife, M. 29 b. Salford

James Caldwell, son, S, 7 b. Bootle

Walter Caldwell, son, S, 5 b. Liverpool

Alice Caldwell, Daur. S. 3 b. Liverpool

Transcript 1911 Census:[9]

Civil Parish of Bootle cum Lanacre, Lancashire. %6 Boswell St, Bootle, Liverpool. Registration district West Derby.

James T. Caldwell (away), Husband, 45 Married.Occupation Seaman. Worker. Born Lancaster, Everton, Liverpool

Alice Caldwell, wife, 40 Wife . completed years of marriage 20. No. of children still living: 8; Children who have died:1 Born Manchester

James T. Caldwell, son, Single, 18 Dock laborer. Worker. Born Lancaster, Bootle Liverpool

Alice Caldwell, Daur. S. 14 Born Lancaster, Liverpool

George Caldwell School 12 Occupation School Born Lancaster Waterloo, Liverpool

Joseph Caldwell 8 Born Lancaster Waterloo, Liverpool

Arthur Caldwell 3 Born Lancaster Waterloo, Liverpool

Robert Caldwell 8 mths Born Lancaster Waterloo, Liverpool

The dwelling contained five rooms.

Document: Short Service (For the Duration of the War). Attestation of James T. Caldwell. Coprs: R. I. INT British. Name: James T. Caldwell. Address 56 Boswell St. Bootle. L. Pool. British Subject. Age 51 Years 5 months. Trade: Boatswain. Married. To the question "Have you ever served in any branch of His Majesty's Forces ... " No. Dated 23 August 1917.[15]

Transcript of Entry of Death [13]

No. 449. When and Where died. Sixteenth August 1934. 152 Irlan Road. Name: James Tyler Caldwell. Male. Age 68 years. Cause of Death Cardiac Thrombosis (rest illegible). Informant: J. T. Caldwell, son. 23 Borden Place, Stratford-upon-avon. When registered, Seventeenth August, 1934. Registrar (Illegible).
